trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot StorSimple device deployment issues | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot StorSimple device deployment issues | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to diagnose and fix errors that occur when you first deploy StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to diagnose and fix errors that occur when you first deploy StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot StorSimple device deployment issues
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot StorSimple device deployment issues

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This article provides helpful troubleshooting guidance for your Microsoft Azure StorSimple deployment.
trans-unit.target: This article provides helpful troubleshooting guidance for your Microsoft Azure StorSimple deployment.

trans-unit.source: It describes common issues, possible causes, and recommended steps to help you resolve problems that you might experience when you configure StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: It describes common issues, possible causes, and recommended steps to help you resolve problems that you might experience when you configure StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: This information applies to both the StorSimple on-premises physical device and the StorSimple virtual device.
trans-unit.target: This information applies to both the StorSimple on-premises physical device and the StorSimple virtual device.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Device configuration-related issues that you may face can occur when you deploy the device for the first time, or they can occur later, when the device is operational.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Device configuration-related issues that you may face can occur when you deploy the device for the first time, or they can occur later, when the device is operational.

trans-unit.source: This article focuses on troubleshooting first-time deployment issues.
trans-unit.target: This article focuses on troubleshooting first-time deployment issues.

trans-unit.source: To troubleshoot an operational device, go to [Troubleshoot operational device issues](storsimple-troubleshoot-operational-device.md).
trans-unit.target: To troubleshoot an operational device, go to [Troubleshoot operational device issues](storsimple-troubleshoot-operational-device.md).

trans-unit.source: This article also describes the tools for troubleshooting StorSimple deployments and provides a step-by-step troubleshooting example.
trans-unit.target: This article also describes the tools for troubleshooting StorSimple deployments and provides a step-by-step troubleshooting example.

trans-unit.source: First-time deployment issues
trans-unit.target: First-time deployment issues

trans-unit.source: If you run into an issue when deploying your device for the first time, consider the following:
trans-unit.target: If you run into an issue when deploying your device for the first time, consider the following:

trans-unit.source: If you are troubleshooting a physical device, make sure that the hardware has been installed and configured as described in [Install your StorSimple 8100 device](storsimple-8100-hardware-installation.md) or [Install your StorSimple 8600 device](storsimple-8600-hardware-installation.md).
trans-unit.target: If you are troubleshooting a physical device, make sure that the hardware has been installed and configured as described in [Install your StorSimple 8100 device](storsimple-8100-hardware-installation.md) or [Install your StorSimple 8600 device](storsimple-8600-hardware-installation.md).

trans-unit.source: Check prerequisites for deployment.
trans-unit.target: Check prerequisites for deployment.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have all the information described in the [deployment configuration checklist](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md#deployment-configuration-checklist).
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have all the information described in the [deployment configuration checklist](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md#deployment-configuration-checklist).

trans-unit.source: Review the StorSimple Release Notes to see if the problem is described.
trans-unit.target: Review the StorSimple Release Notes to see if the problem is described.

trans-unit.source: The release notes include workarounds for known installation problems.
trans-unit.target: The release notes include workarounds for known installation problems.

trans-unit.source: During device deployment, the most common issues that users face occur when they run the setup wizard and when they register the device via Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: During device deployment, the most common issues that users face occur when they run the setup wizard and when they register the device via Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: (You use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to register and configure your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: (You use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to register and configure your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: For more information on device registration, see [Step 3: Configure and register your device through Windows PowerShell for StorSimple](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md#step-3-configure-and-register-the-device-through-windows-powershell-for-storsimple)).
trans-unit.target: For more information on device registration, see [Step 3: Configure and register your device through Windows PowerShell for StorSimple](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md#step-3-configure-and-register-the-device-through-windows-powershell-for-storsimple)).

trans-unit.source: The following sections can help you resolve issues that you encounter when you configure the StorSimple device for the first time.
trans-unit.target: The following sections can help you resolve issues that you encounter when you configure the StorSimple device for the first time.

trans-unit.source: First-time setup wizard process
trans-unit.target: First-time setup wizard process

trans-unit.source: The following steps summarize the setup wizard process.
trans-unit.target: The following steps summarize the setup wizard process.

trans-unit.source: For detailed setup information, see [Deploy your on-premises StorSimple device](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed setup information, see [Deploy your on-premises StorSimple device](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md).

trans-unit.source: Run the [Invoke-HcsSetupWizard](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn688135.aspx) cmdlet to start the setup wizard that will guide you through the remaining steps.
trans-unit.target: Run the [Invoke-HcsSetupWizard](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn688135.aspx) cmdlet to start the setup wizard that will guide you through the remaining steps.

trans-unit.source: Configure the network: the setup wizard lets you configure network settings for the DATA 0 network interface on your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Configure the network: the setup wizard lets you configure network settings for the DATA 0 network interface on your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: These settings include the following:
trans-unit.target: These settings include the following:

trans-unit.source: Virtual IP (VIP), subnet mask, and gateway – The [Set-HcsNetInterface](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn688161.aspx) cmdlet is executed in the background.
trans-unit.target: Virtual IP (VIP), subnet mask, and gateway – The [Set-HcsNetInterface](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn688161.aspx) cmdlet is executed in the background.

trans-unit.source: It configures the IP address, subnet mask, and gateway for the DATA 0 network interface on your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: It configures the IP address, subnet mask, and gateway for the DATA 0 network interface on your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Primary DNS server – The [Set-HcsDnsClientServerAddress](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn688172.aspx) cmdlet is executed in the background.
trans-unit.target: Primary DNS server – The [Set-HcsDnsClientServerAddress](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn688172.aspx) cmdlet is executed in the background.

trans-unit.source: It configures the DNS settings for your StorSimple solution.
trans-unit.target: It configures the DNS settings for your StorSimple solution.

trans-unit.source: NTP server – The [Set-HcsNtpClientServerAddress](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn688138.aspx) cmdlet is executed in the background.
trans-unit.target: NTP server – The [Set-HcsNtpClientServerAddress](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn688138.aspx) cmdlet is executed in the background.

trans-unit.source: It configures the NTP server settings for your StorSimple solution.
trans-unit.target: It configures the NTP server settings for your StorSimple solution.

trans-unit.source: Optional web proxy – The [Set-HcsWebProxy](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn688154.aspx) cmdlet is executed in the background.
trans-unit.target: Optional web proxy – The [Set-HcsWebProxy](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn688154.aspx) cmdlet is executed in the background.

trans-unit.source: It sets and enables the web proxy configuration for your StorSimple solution.
trans-unit.target: It sets and enables the web proxy configuration for your StorSimple solution.

trans-unit.source: Set up the passwords: the next step is to set up device administrator and StorSimple Snapshot Manager passwords.
trans-unit.target: Set up the passwords: the next step is to set up device administrator and StorSimple Snapshot Manager passwords.

trans-unit.source: If you are running Update 1, then you will not be required to set up the StorSimple Snapshot Manager password.
trans-unit.target: If you are running Update 1, then you will not be required to set up the StorSimple Snapshot Manager password.

trans-unit.source: The device administrator password is used to log on to your device.
trans-unit.target: The device administrator password is used to log on to your device.

trans-unit.source: The default device password is **Password1**.
trans-unit.target: The default device password is **Password1**.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Snapshot Manager password is required when you configure a device to use StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Snapshot Manager password is required when you configure a device to use StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: You need to first set the password in the setup wizard, and then you can set and change it from the StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: You need to first set the password in the setup wizard, and then you can set and change it from the StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: This password authenticates the device with StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: This password authenticates the device with StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Passwords are collected before registration, but applied only after you successfully register the device.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Passwords are collected before registration, but applied only after you successfully register the device.

trans-unit.source: If there is a failure to apply a password, you will be prompted to supply the password again until the required passwords (that meet the complexity requirements) are collected.
trans-unit.target: If there is a failure to apply a password, you will be prompted to supply the password again until the required passwords (that meet the complexity requirements) are collected.

trans-unit.source: Register the device: the final step is to register the device with the StorSimple Manager service running in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Register the device: the final step is to register the device with the StorSimple Manager service running in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: The registration requires you to [get the service registration key](storsimple-manage-service.md#get-the-service-registration-key) from the Azure Management Portal, and provide it in the setup wizard.
trans-unit.target: The registration requires you to [get the service registration key](storsimple-manage-service.md#get-the-service-registration-key) from the Azure Management Portal, and provide it in the setup wizard.

trans-unit.source: After the device is successfully registered, a service data encryption key is provided to you.
trans-unit.target: After the device is successfully registered, a service data encryption key is provided to you.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to keep this encryption key in a safe location because it will be required to register all subsequent devices with the service.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to keep this encryption key in a safe location because it will be required to register all subsequent devices with the service.

trans-unit.target: The root cause is one of the following:

trans-unit.source: The cluster is not up.
trans-unit.target: The cluster is not up.

trans-unit.target: The passive controller cannot communicate with the active controller, and the command is run from passive controller.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the root cause:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the root cause:

trans-unit.source: [Contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md) to make sure that the cluster is up.
trans-unit.target: [Contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md) to make sure that the cluster is up.

trans-unit.source: Run the command from the active controller.
trans-unit.target: Run the command from the active controller.

trans-unit.source: If you want to run the command from the passive controller, you will need to ensure that the passive controller can communicate with the active controller.
trans-unit.target: If you want to run the command from the passive controller, you will need to ensure that the passive controller can communicate with the active controller.

trans-unit.source: Errors related to device administrator and StorSimple Snapshot Manager passwords
trans-unit.target: Errors related to device administrator and StorSimple Snapshot Manager passwords

trans-unit.source: The default device administrator password is **Password1**.
trans-unit.target: The default device administrator password is **Password1**.

trans-unit.source: This password expires after the first log on; therefore, you will need to use the setup wizard to change it.
trans-unit.target: This password expires after the first log on; therefore, you will need to use the setup wizard to change it.

trans-unit.source: You must provide a new device administrator password when you register the device for the first time.
trans-unit.target: You must provide a new device administrator password when you register the device for the first time.

trans-unit.source: If you use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager software running on the Windows Server host to manage the device, then you must also provide a StorSimple Snapshot Manager password during first-time registration.
trans-unit.target: If you use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager software running on the Windows Server host to manage the device, then you must also provide a StorSimple Snapshot Manager password during first-time registration.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that your passwords meet the following requirements:
trans-unit.target: Make sure that your passwords meet the following requirements:

trans-unit.source: Your device administrator password should be between 8 and 15 characters long.
trans-unit.target: Your device administrator password should be between 8 and 15 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Your StorSimple Snapshot Manager password should be 14 or 15 characters long.
trans-unit.target: Your StorSimple Snapshot Manager password should be 14 or 15 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Passwords should contain 3 of the following 4 character types: lowercase, uppercase, numeric, and special.
trans-unit.target: Passwords should contain 3 of the following 4 character types: lowercase, uppercase, numeric, and special.

trans-unit.source: Your password cannot be the same as the last 24 passwords.
trans-unit.target: Your password cannot be the same as the last 24 passwords.

trans-unit.source: In addition, keep in mind that passwords expire every year, and can be changed only after you successfully register the device.
trans-unit.target: In addition, keep in mind that passwords expire every year, and can be changed only after you successfully register the device.

trans-unit.source: If the registration fails for any reason, the passwords will not be changed.
trans-unit.target: If the registration fails for any reason, the passwords will not be changed.

trans-unit.source: For more information on device administrator and StorSimple Snapshot Manager passwords, go to [Use the StorSimple Manager service to change your StorSimple passwords](storsimple-change-passwords.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on device administrator and StorSimple Snapshot Manager passwords, go to [Use the StorSimple Manager service to change your StorSimple passwords](storsimple-change-passwords.md).

trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] In general, if an attempt to apply a password fails, then the software repeatedly attempts to collect the password until it is successful.

trans-unit.source: In rare instances, the password cannot be applied.
trans-unit.target: In rare instances, the password cannot be applied.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, you can register the device and proceed, however the passwords will not be changed.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, you can register the device and proceed, however the passwords will not be changed.

trans-unit.source: You will receive no indication as to which password was not changed — the device administrator password or the StorSimple Snapshot Manager password.
trans-unit.target: You will receive no indication as to which password was not changed — the device administrator password or the StorSimple Snapshot Manager password.

trans-unit.source: If this situation occurs, we recommend that you change both passwords.
trans-unit.target: If this situation occurs, we recommend that you change both passwords.

trans-unit.source: You can reset the passwords from the Management Portal of your StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: You can reset the passwords from the Management Portal of your StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see:

trans-unit.source: [Change the device administrator password](storsimple-change-passwords.md#change-the-device-administrator-password).
trans-unit.target: [Change the device administrator password](storsimple-change-passwords.md#change-the-device-administrator-password).

trans-unit.source: [Change the StorSimple Snapshot Manager password](storsimple-change-passwords.md#change-the-storsimple-snapshot-manager-password).
trans-unit.target: [Change the StorSimple Snapshot Manager password](storsimple-change-passwords.md#change-the-storsimple-snapshot-manager-password).

trans-unit.source: Tools for troubleshooting StorSimple deployments
trans-unit.target: Tools for troubleshooting StorSimple deployments

trans-unit.source: StorSimple includes several tools that you can use to troubleshoot your StorSimple solution.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple includes several tools that you can use to troubleshoot your StorSimple solution.

trans-unit.source: These include:
trans-unit.target: These include:

trans-unit.source: Support packages and device logs
trans-unit.target: Support packages and device logs

trans-unit.source: Cmdlets specifically designed for troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Cmdlets specifically designed for troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Support packages and device logs available for troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Support packages and device logs available for troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: A support package contains all the relevant logs that can assist the Microsoft Support team with troubleshooting device issues.
trans-unit.target: A support package contains all the relevant logs that can assist the Microsoft Support team with troubleshooting device issues.

trans-unit.source: You can use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to generate an encrypted support package that you can then share with support personnel.
trans-unit.target: You can use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to generate an encrypted support package that you can then share with support personnel.

trans-unit.source: To view the logs or the contents of the support package
trans-unit.target: To view the logs or the contents of the support package

trans-unit.source: Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to generate a support package as described in [Create and manage a support package](storsimple-create-manage-support-package.md).
trans-unit.target: Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to generate a support package as described in [Create and manage a support package](storsimple-create-manage-support-package.md).

trans-unit.source: Download the [decryption script](https://gallery.technet.microsoft.com/scriptcenter/Script-to-decrypt-a-a8d1ed65) locally on your client computer.
trans-unit.target: Download the [decryption script](https://gallery.technet.microsoft.com/scriptcenter/Script-to-decrypt-a-a8d1ed65) locally on your client computer.

trans-unit.source: Use this [step-by-step procedure](storsimple-create-manage-support-package.md#edit-a-support-package) to open and decrypt the support package.
trans-unit.target: Use this [step-by-step procedure](storsimple-create-manage-support-package.md#edit-a-support-package) to open and decrypt the support package.

trans-unit.source: The decrypted support package logs are in etw/etvx format.
trans-unit.target: The decrypted support package logs are in etw/etvx format.

trans-unit.source: You can perform the following steps to view these files in Windows Event Viewer:
trans-unit.target: You can perform the following steps to view these files in Windows Event Viewer:

trans-unit.source: Run the **eventvwr** command on your Windows client.
trans-unit.target: Run the **eventvwr** command on your Windows client.

trans-unit.source: This will start the Event Viewer.
trans-unit.target: This will start the Event Viewer.

trans-unit.source: In the **Actions** pane, click **Open Saved Log** and point to the log files in etvx/etw format (the support package).
trans-unit.target: In the **Actions** pane, click **Open Saved Log** and point to the log files in etvx/etw format (the support package).

trans-unit.source: You can now view the file.
trans-unit.target: You can now view the file.

trans-unit.source: After you open the file, you can right-click and save the the file as text.
trans-unit.target: After you open the file, you can right-click and save the the file as text.

trans-unit.source: When the logs open in Event Viewer, look for the following logs that contain issues related to the device configuration:
trans-unit.target: When the logs open in Event Viewer, look for the following logs that contain issues related to the device configuration:

trans-unit.source: hcs_pfconfig/Operational Log
trans-unit.target: hcs_pfconfig/Operational Log

trans-unit.source: hcs_pfconfig/Config
trans-unit.target: hcs_pfconfig/Config

trans-unit.source: In the log files, search for strings related to the cmdlets called by the setup wizard.
trans-unit.target: In the log files, search for strings related to the cmdlets called by the setup wizard.

trans-unit.source: See [First-time setup wizard process](#first-time-setup-wizard-process) for a list of these cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: See [First-time setup wizard process](#first-time-setup-wizard-process) for a list of these cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: If you are not able to figure out the cause of the problem, you can [contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md) for next steps.
trans-unit.target: If you are not able to figure out the cause of the problem, you can [contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md) for next steps.

trans-unit.source: Use the steps in [Create a support request](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md#create-a-support-request) when you contact Microsoft Support for assistance.
trans-unit.target: Use the steps in [Create a support request](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md#create-a-support-request) when you contact Microsoft Support for assistance.

trans-unit.source: Cmdlets available for troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Cmdlets available for troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Use the following Windows PowerShell cmdlets to detect connectivity errors.
trans-unit.target: Use the following Windows PowerShell cmdlets to detect connectivity errors.

trans-unit.source: `Get-NetAdapter`: Use this cmdlet to detect the health of network interfaces.
trans-unit.target: `Get-NetAdapter`: Use this cmdlet to detect the health of network interfaces.

trans-unit.source: `Test-Connection`: Use this cmdlet to check the network connectivity inside and outside of the network.
trans-unit.target: `Test-Connection`: Use this cmdlet to check the network connectivity inside and outside of the network.

trans-unit.source: `Test-HcsmConnection`: Use this cmdlet to check the connectivity of a successfully registered device.
trans-unit.target: `Test-HcsmConnection`: Use this cmdlet to check the connectivity of a successfully registered device.

trans-unit.source: If you are running Update 1 on your StorSimple device, the following diagnostic cmdlets are also available.
trans-unit.target: If you are running Update 1 on your StorSimple device, the following diagnostic cmdlets are also available.

trans-unit.source: `Sync-HcsTime`: Use this cmdlet to display device time and force a time sync with the NTP server.
trans-unit.target: `Sync-HcsTime`: Use this cmdlet to display device time and force a time sync with the NTP server.

trans-unit.source: `Enable-HcsPing` and `Disable-HcsPing`: Use these cmdlets to allow the hosts to ping the network interfaces on your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: `Enable-HcsPing` and `Disable-HcsPing`: Use these cmdlets to allow the hosts to ping the network interfaces on your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: By default, the StorSimple network interfaces do not respond to ping requests.
trans-unit.target: By default, the StorSimple network interfaces do not respond to ping requests.

trans-unit.source: `Trace-HcsRoute`: Use this cmdlet as a route tracing tool.
trans-unit.target: `Trace-HcsRoute`: Use this cmdlet as a route tracing tool.

trans-unit.source: It sends packets to each router on the way to a final destination over a period of time, and then computes results based on the packets returned from each hop.
trans-unit.target: It sends packets to each router on the way to a final destination over a period of time, and then computes results based on the packets returned from each hop.

trans-unit.source: Since `Trace-HcsRoute` shows the degree of packet loss at any given router or link, you can pinpoint which routers or links might be causing network problems.
trans-unit.target: Since `Trace-HcsRoute` shows the degree of packet loss at any given router or link, you can pinpoint which routers or links might be causing network problems.

trans-unit.source: `Get-HcsRoutingTable`: Use this cmdlet to display the local IP routing table.
trans-unit.target: `Get-HcsRoutingTable`: Use this cmdlet to display the local IP routing table.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot with the Get-NetAdapter cmdlet
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot with the Get-NetAdapter cmdlet

trans-unit.source: When you configure network interfaces for a first-time device deployment, the hardware status is not available in the StorSimple Manager service UI because the device is not yet registered with the service.
trans-unit.target: When you configure network interfaces for a first-time device deployment, the hardware status is not available in the StorSimple Manager service UI because the device is not yet registered with the service.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the Hardware Status page may not always correctly reflect the state of the device, especially if there are issues that affect service synchronization.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the Hardware Status page may not always correctly reflect the state of the device, especially if there are issues that affect service synchronization.

trans-unit.source: In these situations, you can use the `Get-NetAdapter` cmdlet to determine the health and status of your network interfaces.
trans-unit.target: In these situations, you can use the `Get-NetAdapter` cmdlet to determine the health and status of your network interfaces.

trans-unit.source: To see a list of all the network adapters on your device
trans-unit.target: To see a list of all the network adapters on your device

trans-unit.source: Start Windows PowerShell for StorSimple, and then type `Get-NetAdapter`.
trans-unit.target: Start Windows PowerShell for StorSimple, and then type `Get-NetAdapter`.

trans-unit.source: Use the output of the `Get-NetAdapter` cmdlet and the following guidelines to understand the status of your network interface.
trans-unit.target: Use the output of the `Get-NetAdapter` cmdlet and the following guidelines to understand the status of your network interface.

trans-unit.source: If the interface is healthy and enabled, the **ifIndex** status is shown as **Up**.
trans-unit.target: If the interface is healthy and enabled, the **ifIndex** status is shown as **Up**.

trans-unit.source: If the interface is healthy but is not physically connected (by a network cable), the **ifIndex** is shown as **Disabled**.
trans-unit.target: If the interface is healthy but is not physically connected (by a network cable), the **ifIndex** is shown as **Disabled**.

trans-unit.source: If the interface is healthy but not enabled, the **ifIndex** status is shown as **NotPresent**.
trans-unit.target: If the interface is healthy but not enabled, the **ifIndex** status is shown as **NotPresent**.

trans-unit.source: If the interface does not exist, it does not appear in this list.
trans-unit.target: If the interface does not exist, it does not appear in this list.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Manager service UI will still show this interface in a failed state.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Manager service UI will still show this interface in a failed state.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how to use this cmdlet, go to [GetNetAdapter](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/jj130867.aspx) in the Windows PowerShell cmdlet reference.
trans-unit.target: For more information on how to use this cmdlet, go to [GetNetAdapter](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/jj130867.aspx) in the Windows PowerShell cmdlet reference.

trans-unit.source: The following sections show samples of output from the `Get-NetAdapter` cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: The following sections show samples of output from the `Get-NetAdapter` cmdlet.

trans-unit.target: In these samples, controller 0 was the passive controller, and was configured as follows:

trans-unit.target: DATA 0, DATA 1, DATA 2, and DATA 3 network interfaces existed on the device.

trans-unit.source: DATA 4 and DATA 5 network interface cards were not present; therefore, they are not listed in the output.
trans-unit.target: DATA 4 and DATA 5 network interface cards were not present; therefore, they are not listed in the output.

trans-unit.source: DATA 0 was enabled.
trans-unit.target: DATA 0 was enabled.

trans-unit.source: Controller 1 was the active controller, and was configured as follows:
trans-unit.target: Controller 1 was the active controller, and was configured as follows:

trans-unit.source: DATA 0, DATA 1, DATA 2, DATA 3, DATA 4, and DATA 5 network interfaces existed on the device.
trans-unit.target: DATA 0, DATA 1, DATA 2, DATA 3, DATA 4, and DATA 5 network interfaces existed on the device.

trans-unit.source: DATA 0 was enabled.
trans-unit.target: DATA 0 was enabled.

trans-unit.target: Sample output – controller 0

trans-unit.target: The following is the output from controller 0 (the passive controller).

trans-unit.target: DATA 1, DATA 2, and DATA 3 are not connected.

trans-unit.target: DATA 4 and DATA 5 are not listed because they are not present on the device.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot with the Test-Connection cmdlet
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot with the Test-Connection cmdlet

trans-unit.source: You can use the `Test-Connection` cmdlet to determine whether your StorSimple device can connect to the outside network.
trans-unit.target: You can use the `Test-Connection` cmdlet to determine whether your StorSimple device can connect to the outside network.

trans-unit.source: If all the networking parameters, including the DNS, are configured correctly in the setup wizard, you can use the `Test-Connection` cmdlet to ping a known address outside of the network, such as outlook.com.
trans-unit.target: If all the networking parameters, including the DNS, are configured correctly in the setup wizard, you can use the `Test-Connection` cmdlet to ping a known address outside of the network, such as outlook.com.

trans-unit.source: See the following samples of output from the `Test-Connection` cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: See the following samples of output from the `Test-Connection` cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] In the first sample, the device is configured with an incorrect DNS.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] In the first sample, the device is configured with an incorrect DNS.

trans-unit.source: In the second sample, the DNS is correct.
trans-unit.target: In the second sample, the DNS is correct.

trans-unit.source: Sample output – incorrect DNS
trans-unit.target: Sample output – incorrect DNS

trans-unit.source: In the following sample, there is no output for the IPV4 and IPV6 addresses, which indicates that the DNS is not resolved.
trans-unit.target: In the following sample, there is no output for the IPV4 and IPV6 addresses, which indicates that the DNS is not resolved.

trans-unit.source: This means that there is no connectivity to the outside network and a correct DNS needs to be supplied.
trans-unit.target: This means that there is no connectivity to the outside network and a correct DNS needs to be supplied.

trans-unit.source: Sample output – correct DNS
trans-unit.target: Sample output – correct DNS

trans-unit.source: In the following sample, the DNS returns the IPV4 address, indicating that the DNS is configured correctly.
trans-unit.target: In the following sample, the DNS returns the IPV4 address, indicating that the DNS is configured correctly.

trans-unit.source: This confirms that there is connectivity to the outside network.
trans-unit.target: This confirms that there is connectivity to the outside network.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot with the Test-HcsmConnection cmdlet
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot with the Test-HcsmConnection cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Use the `Test-HcsmConnection` cmdlet for a device that is already connected to and registered with your StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: Use the `Test-HcsmConnection` cmdlet for a device that is already connected to and registered with your StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: This cmdlet helps you verify the connectivity between a registered device and the corresponding StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: This cmdlet helps you verify the connectivity between a registered device and the corresponding StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: You can run this command on Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: You can run this command on Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: To run the Test-HcsmConnection cmdlet
trans-unit.target: To run the Test-HcsmConnection cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the device is registered.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the device is registered.

trans-unit.source: Check the device status.
trans-unit.target: Check the device status.

trans-unit.source: If the device is deactivated, in maintenance mode, or offline, you might see the following errors:
trans-unit.target: If the device is deactivated, in maintenance mode, or offline, you might see the following errors:

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.CiSDeviceDecommissioned – this indicates that the device is deactivated.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CiSDeviceDecommissioned – this indicates that the device is deactivated.

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.DeviceNotReady – this indicates that the device is in maintenance mode.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.DeviceNotReady – this indicates that the device is in maintenance mode.

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.DeviceNotReady – this indicates that the device is not online.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.DeviceNotReady – this indicates that the device is not online.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the StorSimple Manager service is running (use the [Get-ClusterResource](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ee461004.aspx) cmdlet).
trans-unit.target: Verify that the StorSimple Manager service is running (use the [Get-ClusterResource](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ee461004.aspx) cmdlet).

trans-unit.source: If the service is not running, you might see the following errors:
trans-unit.target: If the service is not running, you might see the following errors:

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceAgentNotOnline
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceAgentNotOnline

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.CisPowershellScriptHcsError – this indicates that there was an exception when you ran Get-ClusterResource.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CisPowershellScriptHcsError – this indicates that there was an exception when you ran Get-ClusterResource.

trans-unit.source: Check the Access Control Service (ACS) token.
trans-unit.target: Check the Access Control Service (ACS) token.

trans-unit.source: If it throws a web exception, it might be the result of a gateway problem, a missing proxy authentication, an incorrect DNS, or an authentication failure.
trans-unit.target: If it throws a web exception, it might be the result of a gateway problem, a missing proxy authentication, an incorrect DNS, or an authentication failure.

trans-unit.source: You might see the following errors:
trans-unit.target: You might see the following errors:

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceGateway – this indicates an HttpStatusCode.BadGateway exception: the name resolver service could not resolve the host name.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceGateway – this indicates an HttpStatusCode.BadGateway exception: the name resolver service could not resolve the host name.

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceProxy – this indicates an HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired exception (HTTP status code 407): the client could not authenticate with the proxy server.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceProxy – this indicates an HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired exception (HTTP status code 407): the client could not authenticate with the proxy server.

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceDNSError – this indicates a WebExceptionStatus.NameResolutionFailure exception: the name resolver service could not resolve the host name.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceDNSError – this indicates a WebExceptionStatus.NameResolutionFailure exception: the name resolver service could not resolve the host name.

trans-unit.source: If it does not throw a web exception, check for ErrorCode.CiSApplianceFailure.
trans-unit.target: If it does not throw a web exception, check for ErrorCode.CiSApplianceFailure.

trans-unit.source: This indicates that the appliance failed.
trans-unit.target: This indicates that the appliance failed.

trans-unit.target: Check the cloud service connectivity.

trans-unit.target: If the service throws a web exception, you might see the following errors:

trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceGateway – this indicates an HttpStatusCode.BadGateway exception: an intermediate proxy server received a bad request from another proxy or from the original server.

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceProxy – this indicates an HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired exception (HTTP status code 407): the client could not authenticate with the proxy server.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceProxy – this indicates an HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired exception (HTTP status code 407): the client could not authenticate with the proxy server.

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceDNSError – this indicates a WebExceptionStatus.NameResolutionFailure exception: the name resolver service could not resolve the host name.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceDNSError – this indicates a WebExceptionStatus.NameResolutionFailure exception: the name resolver service could not resolve the host name.

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceACSError – this indicates that the service returned an authentication error, but there is connectivity.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceACSError – this indicates that the service returned an authentication error, but there is connectivity.

trans-unit.source: If it does not throw a web exception, check for ErrorCode.CiSApplianceSaasServiceError.
trans-unit.target: If it does not throw a web exception, check for ErrorCode.CiSApplianceSaasServiceError.

trans-unit.source: This indicates a problem with the StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: This indicates a problem with the StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: Check Azure Service Bus connectivity.
trans-unit.target: Check Azure Service Bus connectivity.

trans-unit.source: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceServiceBusError indicates that the device cannot connect to the Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: ErrorCode.CiSApplianceServiceBusError indicates that the device cannot connect to the Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: The log files CiSCommandletLog0Curr.errlog and CiSAgentsvc0Curr.errlog will have more information, such as exception details.
trans-unit.target: The log files CiSCommandletLog0Curr.errlog and CiSAgentsvc0Curr.errlog will have more information, such as exception details.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] You can run this cmdlet for both the active and the passive controller.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot with the Sync-HcsTime cmdlet
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot with the Sync-HcsTime cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Use this cmdlet to display the device time.
trans-unit.target: Use this cmdlet to display the device time.

trans-unit.source: If the device time has an offset with the NTP server, you can then use this cmdlet to force-synchronize the time with your NTP server.
trans-unit.target: If the device time has an offset with the NTP server, you can then use this cmdlet to force-synchronize the time with your NTP server.

trans-unit.source: If the offset between the device and NTP server is greater than 5 minutes, you will see a warning.
trans-unit.target: If the offset between the device and NTP server is greater than 5 minutes, you will see a warning.

trans-unit.source: If the offset exceeds 15 minutes, then the device will go offline.
trans-unit.target: If the offset exceeds 15 minutes, then the device will go offline.

trans-unit.source: You can still use this cmdlet to force a time sync.
trans-unit.target: You can still use this cmdlet to force a time sync.

trans-unit.source: However, if the offset exceeds 15 hours, then you will not be able to force-sync the time and an error message will be shown.
trans-unit.target: However, if the offset exceeds 15 hours, then you will not be able to force-sync the time and an error message will be shown.

trans-unit.source: Sample output – forced time sync using Sync-HcsTime
trans-unit.target: Sample output – forced time sync using Sync-HcsTime

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot with the Enable-HcsPing and Disable-HcsPing cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot with the Enable-HcsPing and Disable-HcsPing cmdlets

trans-unit.source: Use these cmdlets to ensure that the network interfaces on your device respond to ICMP ping requests.
trans-unit.target: Use these cmdlets to ensure that the network interfaces on your device respond to ICMP ping requests.

trans-unit.source: By default the StorSimple network interfaces do not respond to ping requests.
trans-unit.target: By default the StorSimple network interfaces do not respond to ping requests.

trans-unit.source: Using this cmdlet is the easiest way to know if your device is online and reachable.
trans-unit.target: Using this cmdlet is the easiest way to know if your device is online and reachable.

trans-unit.source: Sample output – Enable-HcsPing and Disable-HcsPing
trans-unit.target: Sample output – Enable-HcsPing and Disable-HcsPing

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot with the Trace-HcsRoute cmdlet
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot with the Trace-HcsRoute cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Use this cmdlet as a route tracing tool.
trans-unit.target: Use this cmdlet as a route tracing tool.

trans-unit.source: It sends packets to each router on the way to a final destination over a period of time, and then computes results based on the packets returned from each hop.
trans-unit.target: It sends packets to each router on the way to a final destination over a period of time, and then computes results based on the packets returned from each hop.

trans-unit.source: Because the cmdlet shows the degree of packet loss at any given router or link, you can pinpoint which routers or links might be causing network problems.
trans-unit.target: Because the cmdlet shows the degree of packet loss at any given router or link, you can pinpoint which routers or links might be causing network problems.

trans-unit.source: Sample output showing how to trace the route of a packet with Trace-HcsRoute
trans-unit.target: Sample output showing how to trace the route of a packet with Trace-HcsRoute

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot with the Get-HcsRoutingTable cmdlet
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot with the Get-HcsRoutingTable cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Use this cmdlet to view the routing table for your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Use this cmdlet to view the routing table for your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: A routing table is a set of rules that can help determine where data packets traveling over an Internet Protocol (IP) network will be directed.
trans-unit.target: A routing table is a set of rules that can help determine where data packets traveling over an Internet Protocol (IP) network will be directed.

trans-unit.source: The routing table shows the interfaces and the gateway that routes the data to the specified networks.
trans-unit.target: The routing table shows the interfaces and the gateway that routes the data to the specified networks.

trans-unit.source: It also gives the routing metric which is the decision maker for the path taken to reach a particular destination.
trans-unit.target: It also gives the routing metric which is the decision maker for the path taken to reach a particular destination.

trans-unit.source: The lower the routing metric, the higher the preference.
trans-unit.target: The lower the routing metric, the higher the preference.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have 2 network interfaces, DATA 2 and DATA 3, connected to the Internet.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have 2 network interfaces, DATA 2 and DATA 3, connected to the Internet.

trans-unit.source: If the routing metrics for DATA 2 and DATA 3 are 15 and 261 respectively, then DATA 2 with the lower routing metric is the preferred interface used to reach the Internet.
trans-unit.target: If the routing metrics for DATA 2 and DATA 3 are 15 and 261 respectively, then DATA 2 with the lower routing metric is the preferred interface used to reach the Internet.

trans-unit.source: If you are running Update 1 on your StorSimple device, your DATA 0 network interface has the highest preference for the cloud traffic.
trans-unit.target: If you are running Update 1 on your StorSimple device, your DATA 0 network interface has the highest preference for the cloud traffic.

trans-unit.source: This implies that even if there are other cloud-enabled interfaces, the cloud traffic would be routed through DATA 0.
trans-unit.target: This implies that even if there are other cloud-enabled interfaces, the cloud traffic would be routed through DATA 0.

trans-unit.source: If you run the `Get-HcsRoutingTable` cmdlet without specifying any parameters (as the following example shows), the cmdlet will output both IPv4 and IPv6 routing tables.
trans-unit.target: If you run the `Get-HcsRoutingTable` cmdlet without specifying any parameters (as the following example shows), the cmdlet will output both IPv4 and IPv6 routing tables.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can specify `Get-HcsRoutingTable -IPv4` or `Get-HcsRoutingTable -IPv6` to get a relevant routing table.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can specify `Get-HcsRoutingTable -IPv4` or `Get-HcsRoutingTable -IPv6` to get a relevant routing table.

trans-unit.source: Step-by-step StorSimple troubleshooting example
trans-unit.target: Step-by-step StorSimple troubleshooting example

trans-unit.source: The following example shows step-by-step troubleshooting of a StorSimple deployment.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows step-by-step troubleshooting of a StorSimple deployment.

trans-unit.source: In the example scenario, device registration fails with an error message indicating that the network settings or the DNS name is incorrect.
trans-unit.target: In the example scenario, device registration fails with an error message indicating that the network settings or the DNS name is incorrect.

trans-unit.source: The error message returned is:
trans-unit.target: The error message returned is:

trans-unit.source: The error could be caused by any of the following:
trans-unit.target: The error could be caused by any of the following:

trans-unit.source: Incorrect hardware installation
trans-unit.target: Incorrect hardware installation

trans-unit.source: Faulty network interface(s)
trans-unit.target: Faulty network interface(s)

trans-unit.source: Incorrect IP address, subnet mask, gateway, primary DNS server, or web proxy
trans-unit.target: Incorrect IP address, subnet mask, gateway, primary DNS server, or web proxy

trans-unit.source: Incorrect registration key
trans-unit.target: Incorrect registration key

trans-unit.source: Incorrect firewall settings
trans-unit.target: Incorrect firewall settings

trans-unit.source: To locate and fix the device registration problem
trans-unit.target: To locate and fix the device registration problem

trans-unit.source: Check your device configuration: on the active controller, run `Invoke-HcsSetupWizard`.
trans-unit.target: Check your device configuration: on the active controller, run `Invoke-HcsSetupWizard`.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The setup wizard must run on the active controller.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The setup wizard must run on the active controller.

trans-unit.source: To verify that you are connected to the active controller, look at the banner presented in the serial console.
trans-unit.target: To verify that you are connected to the active controller, look at the banner presented in the serial console.

trans-unit.source: The banner indicates whether you are connected to controller 0 or controller 1, and whether the controller is active or passive.
trans-unit.target: The banner indicates whether you are connected to controller 0 or controller 1, and whether the controller is active or passive.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to [Identify an active controller on your device](storsimple-controller-replacement.md#identify-the-active-controller-on-your-device).
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to [Identify an active controller on your device](storsimple-controller-replacement.md#identify-the-active-controller-on-your-device).

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the device is cabled correctly: check the network cabling on the device back plane.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the device is cabled correctly: check the network cabling on the device back plane.

trans-unit.source: The cabling is specific to the device model.
trans-unit.target: The cabling is specific to the device model.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to [Install your StorSimple 8100 device](storsimple-8100-hardware-installation.md) or [Install your StorSimple 8600 device](storsimple-8600-hardware-installation.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to [Install your StorSimple 8100 device](storsimple-8100-hardware-installation.md) or [Install your StorSimple 8600 device](storsimple-8600-hardware-installation.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using 10 GbE network ports, you will need to use the provided QSFP-SFP adapters and SFP cables.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using 10 GbE network ports, you will need to use the provided QSFP-SFP adapters and SFP cables.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [list of cables, switches, and transceivers recommended by the OEM supplier for Mellanox ports](http://www.mellanox.com/page/cables?mtag=cable_overview).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [list of cables, switches, and transceivers recommended by the OEM supplier for Mellanox ports](http://www.mellanox.com/page/cables?mtag=cable_overview).

trans-unit.source: Verify the health of the network interface:
trans-unit.target: Verify the health of the network interface:

trans-unit.source: Use the Get-NetAdapter cmdlet to detect the health of the network interfaces for DATA 0.
trans-unit.target: Use the Get-NetAdapter cmdlet to detect the health of the network interfaces for DATA 0.

trans-unit.source: If the link isn't functioning, the **ifindex** status will indicate that the interface is down.
trans-unit.target: If the link isn't functioning, the **ifindex** status will indicate that the interface is down.

trans-unit.source: You will then need to check the network connection of the port to the appliance and to the switch.
trans-unit.target: You will then need to check the network connection of the port to the appliance and to the switch.

trans-unit.source: You will also need to rule out bad cables.
trans-unit.target: You will also need to rule out bad cables.

trans-unit.source: If you suspect that the DATA 0 port on the active controller has failed, you can confirm this by connecting to the DATA 0 port on controller 1.
trans-unit.target: If you suspect that the DATA 0 port on the active controller has failed, you can confirm this by connecting to the DATA 0 port on controller 1.

trans-unit.source: To confirm this, disconnect the network cable from the back of the device from controller 0, connect the cable to controller 1, and then run the Get-NetAdapter cmdlet again.
trans-unit.target: To confirm this, disconnect the network cable from the back of the device from controller 0, connect the cable to controller 1, and then run the Get-NetAdapter cmdlet again.

trans-unit.source: If the DATA 0 port on a controller fails, [contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md) for next steps.
trans-unit.target: If the DATA 0 port on a controller fails, [contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md) for next steps.

trans-unit.source: You might need to replace the controller on your system.
trans-unit.target: You might need to replace the controller on your system.

trans-unit.source: Verify the connectivity to the switch:
trans-unit.target: Verify the connectivity to the switch:

trans-unit.source: Make sure that DATA 0 network interfaces on controller 0 and controller 1 in your primary enclosure are on the same subnet.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that DATA 0 network interfaces on controller 0 and controller 1 in your primary enclosure are on the same subnet.

trans-unit.source: Check the hub or router.
trans-unit.target: Check the hub or router.

trans-unit.source: Typically, you should connect both controllers to the same hub or router.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you should connect both controllers to the same hub or router.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the switches you use for the connection have DATA 0 for both controllers in the same vLAN.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the switches you use for the connection have DATA 0 for both controllers in the same vLAN.

trans-unit.source: Eliminate any user errors:
trans-unit.target: Eliminate any user errors:

trans-unit.source: Run the setup wizard again (run **Invoke-HcsSetupWizard**), and enter the values again to make sure that there are no errors.
trans-unit.target: Run the setup wizard again (run **Invoke-HcsSetupWizard**), and enter the values again to make sure that there are no errors.

trans-unit.source: Verify the registration key used.
trans-unit.target: Verify the registration key used.

trans-unit.source: The same registration key can be used to connect multiple devices to a StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: The same registration key can be used to connect multiple devices to a StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: Use the procedure in [Get the service registration key](storsimple-manage-service.md#get-the-service-registration-key) to ensure that you are using the correct registration key.
trans-unit.target: Use the procedure in [Get the service registration key](storsimple-manage-service.md#get-the-service-registration-key) to ensure that you are using the correct registration key.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you have multiple services running, you will need to ensure that the registration key for the appropriate service is used to register the device.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you have multiple services running, you will need to ensure that the registration key for the appropriate service is used to register the device.

trans-unit.source: If you have registered a device with the wrong StorSimple Manager service, you will need to [contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md) for next steps.
trans-unit.target: If you have registered a device with the wrong StorSimple Manager service, you will need to [contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md) for next steps.

trans-unit.source: You may have to perform a factory reset of the device (which could result in data loss) to then connect it to the intended service.
trans-unit.target: You may have to perform a factory reset of the device (which could result in data loss) to then connect it to the intended service.

trans-unit.source: Use the Test-Connection cmdlet to verify that you have connectivity to the outside network.
trans-unit.target: Use the Test-Connection cmdlet to verify that you have connectivity to the outside network.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to [Troubleshoot with the Test-Connection cmdlet](#troubleshoot-with-the-test-connection-cmdlet).
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to [Troubleshoot with the Test-Connection cmdlet](#troubleshoot-with-the-test-connection-cmdlet).

trans-unit.source: Check for firewall interference.
trans-unit.target: Check for firewall interference.

trans-unit.source: If you have verified that the virtual IP (VIP), subnet, gateway, and DNS settings are all correct, and you still see connectivity issues, then it is possible that your firewall is blocking communication between your device and the outside network.
trans-unit.target: If you have verified that the virtual IP (VIP), subnet, gateway, and DNS settings are all correct, and you still see connectivity issues, then it is possible that your firewall is blocking communication between your device and the outside network.

trans-unit.source: You need to ensure that ports 80 and 443 are available on your StorSimple device for outbound communication.
trans-unit.target: You need to ensure that ports 80 and 443 are available on your StorSimple device for outbound communication.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Networking requirements for your StorSimple device](storsimple-system-requirements.md#networking-requirements-for-your-storsimple-device).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Networking requirements for your StorSimple device](storsimple-system-requirements.md#networking-requirements-for-your-storsimple-device).

trans-unit.source: Look at the logs.
trans-unit.target: Look at the logs.

trans-unit.source: Go to [Support packages and device logs available for troubleshooting](#support-packages-and-device-logs-available-for-troubleshooting).
trans-unit.target: Go to [Support packages and device logs available for troubleshooting](#support-packages-and-device-logs-available-for-troubleshooting).

trans-unit.source: If the preceding steps do not solve the problem, [contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md) for assistance.
trans-unit.target: If the preceding steps do not solve the problem, [contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md) for assistance.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: [Learn how to troubleshoot an operational device](storsimple-troubleshoot-operational-device.md).
